trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemCreated"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDataBound"></xref> events.
Before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control can be rendered, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object must be created for each item in the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemCreated> event is raised every time that an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control is created.
This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever an item is created, such as adding custom content to an item.
Similarly, before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control can be rendered, every item in the control must be bound to a record in the data source.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDataBound> event is raised when an item (represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object) is bound to data in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
This enables you to perform a custom routine whenever an item is bound to data, such as modifying the values of the data before they are displayed.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs> object is passed to the event-handling method, which enables you to access the properties of the item that raised the event.

To determine which item type (data item, empty item, or insert item) is being created, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs> class.
This constructor is primarily used by control developers when they raise events.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs> class.
Property
Initial value
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object that is contained in the `item` parameter.
The item being created or data-bound.
Gets the item that is being created or bound to data.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemEventArgs.Item%2A> property to access the properties of the item that is being created or bound to data.

To determine which item type (data item, empty item, or insert item) is being created, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object.
The item that is being created or bound to data.
